policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation

title.narrative: Number of HD publications and publications by HD staff in non-HD platforms
Number of HD publications and publications by HD staff in non-HD platforms

actual.value: External engagements and contributions include: the Swiss-Chinese Policy Dialogue. The Centre of Competence for Humanitarian Negotiations. Executive Director participation in ‘Trends in mediation’ event in Bern. Executive Director participation in the WEF Asian summit. Transitional Governance presentation in Ukraine. Advising the HEID-Swisspeace-UNU project on sanction and mediation. Advisory role for SRSC project on conflict resolution. Advisory role for a project of the University of Birmingham. Panel participation in a WTO Peace and Business event. and moderation of a DCAF event on peace and SSR.

title.narrative: Mediation processes that contribute to agreements, political solutions and ceasefires
Mediation processes that contribute to agreements, political solutions and ceasefires

target.value: 5 peaceagreement. 20 local-level agreements. 10 interim results per year

actual.value: HD was active in 25 countries in 2018 and delivered or supported more than 25 agreements. ceasefires or measures that brought warring parties together at national. regional or local levels. created platforms for dialogue across conflict lines or opened up humanitarian access to communities battered by conflict. • HD projects have generated or facilitated 6 peace agreements and facilitated 3 violence reduction measures such as ceasefires. HD had 3 significant successes in mediating humanitarian access and agreements. contributing to more than 70.000 children being vaccinated and civilians being evacuated from conflict zones. HD enabled 7 confidence-building measures. rapprochements. joint declarations or commitments by conflict parties. HD established 2 new contacts and channels of communications with and between conflict parties and HD received 4 new mandates to mediate between conflict parties.

title.narrative: Number of projects and assessments through the three M&E components: peer review, process logic assessment and reporting on the observable results
Number of projects and assessments through the three M&E components: peer review, process logic assessment and reporting on the observable results

actual.value:
In 2018. more than 80% of peer reviews included internal and external peers:
• 90% (9 out of 10) of peer reviews included an external peer • 90% (9 out of 10) of peer reviews included an internal peer from another project • 80% (8 out of 10) of peer reviews included an internal peer from another region

title.narrative: Number of events and networks that HD organised or contributed to which enable learning and the sharing of insights
Number of events and networks that HD organised or contributed to which enable learning and the sharing of insights

actual.value:
• HD contributed to more than 20 formal engagements outside HD and a dozen professional networks linking peacemaking practitioners.
• HD’s Executive Director was appointed by the UN Secretary General to the High-Level Advisory Board on Mediation.
• Collaboration with UN’s DPA-MSU on new tech and mediation (as per request of the UNSG).
• HD staff contributed to experts panels on. among others. inclusion in peacemaking. Mediating Security in Peace Processes. and cyber-mediation.
• HD staff taught in at least 5 courses on mediation.
• HD participates in the UK-funded Smart Peace consortium to help develop new and innovative conflict resolution approaches. with a focus on Nigeria. Centreal African Republic and Myanmar.

title.narrative: Sharing of insights within HD and the wider mediation community to improve mediation practice across HD’s portfolio and globally
Sharing of insights within HD and the wider mediation community to improve mediation practice across HD’s portfolio and globally
